column2: Edicts are a forced law change bypassing the legislative bodies of the realm and ignoring the wishes of all vassals. To enact them requires a strong, decisive or devious leader, or overwhelming popularity amongst your vassals.
Issuing an Edict is considered a dishonourable and tyrannical action. Your opinion will suffer with your vassals for not only changing the law but doing so in such a tyrannical way.
Issue an Edict, establishing Minimal Crown Levy as a law of your realm.
To issue an edict, a ruler must not be weak, craven, slothful or content.
This ruler has recently issued an Edict. While the messengers are dispatched across the realm and the bureaucracy of the realm adjusts to the new rules, no further edicts may be issued.
